title: The Bachelorette: Angie Kent admits to getting Botox 'once every year'
text:
Angie Kent recently denied getting cosmetic work especially for The Bachelorette.

And while this may be true, Botox and cheek filler has been part of the 29-year-old's beauty routine for several years.

She told The Daily Telegraph on Wednesday: 'They say it is preventive. I just love it… just a little bit. You don't need it often, maybe once every year.'

'I love just a little bit!' The Bachelorette's Angie Kent has admitted to getting Botox and cheek filler 'once every year'

She added: 'I have got real everything but I look after my skin so I get a little bit of [Botox] and cheeky fillers.

'There has been a lot of talk about me having lots of work, that is not true. I haven't had plastic surgery.'

Earlier this week, Angie said she had steered clear of getting any additional work done in preparation for The Bachelorette.

Candid: She told The Daily Telegraph on Wednesday, 'They say [Botox] is preventive. I just love it… just a little bit. You don't need it often, maybe once every year'

'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told NW magazine.

'That's 100 per cent not true. I've just lost weight, no extra work.'

Meanwhile, Angie isn't the first Bachelorette to face cosmetic surgery rumours.

All in moderation! Earlier this week, Angie said she had steered clear of getting any additional work done in preparation for The Bachelorette

Last year, Ali Oetjen sparked debate among fans after debuting on the show with a suspiciously plump pout and very taut complexion.

Interestingly, Angie commented on Ali's appearance on Gogglebox at the time while watching The Bachelorette premiere with her housemate Yvie Jones.

'I can't tell [that Ali is excited] because [her] face isn't moving!' she said.

The Bachelorette premieres Wednesday at 7.30pm on Channel 10

Not the first! Last year's Bachelorette Ali Oetjen (pictured) sparked debate among fans after debuting on the show with a suspiciously plump pout and very taut complexion
description: Angie Kent recently denied getting cosmetic work especially for The Bachelorette.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
